results.title: Hearts of darkness: a filmmaker's apocalypse
results.creator_credit: Eleanor Coppola, George Hickenlooper, Fax Bahr, Les Mayfield, George Zaloom and ZM Productions
results.brief_description: The making of “Apocalypse now” was almost the breaking of famed director Francis Ford Coppola. For three years Coppola drove and dragged his actors, including Robert Duvall, Martin Sheen, Marlon Brando, and his crew through torturous conditions to complete his epic portrayal of the Vietnam War. Recreating the savagery of war left its mark - Sheen overcame a heart attack to finish the film and Coppola privately questioned his sanity. This riveting, funny and at times shocking film charts the progress of Coppola’s dream, which he personally funded to completion. It is brutally honest and includes improvisation, often drug-induced, which made it to the big screen as “brilliant performances”. Features exclusively restored footage previously deleted from “Apocalypse now”, “Hearts of darkness” is a tragedy, comedy and disaster rolled into one.

results.title: The Fly
results.creator_credit: Kurt Neumann and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the classic horror tale of science gone wrong. Vincent Price plays the brother of a brilliant scientist (Al Hedison), who discovers how to transport matter through space. Hedison’s atoms intermingle with those of a common housefly, leaving him with the insect’s head on his body and vice versa. A gruesome freak of nature, he battles to return to normality, however the process slowly drains him of human will. This 1950’s thriller, scripted by acclaimed author James Clavell is capped by a climax which is simultaneously eerie and touching.

results.title: Little women (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Louisa May Alcott’s popular novel is brought vividly to life in this second screen adaption of “Little Women.” The March sisters are Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Janet Leigh), Amy (a blonde Elizabeth Taylor) and Meg (child-star Margaret O’Brien). Their father has left for the Civil War, leaving the girls under the watchful eye of their mother (Mary Astor). Far removed from war and safe within their New England home, the “little women” are a closely-knit family and a picture of happiness. When Laurie (Peter Lawford), the grandson of a rich neighbor arrives, the orderly world of the March family is disrupted. The sisters are smitten by this handsome stranger and a story of romance, rivalry, love and loss follows. As the high spirited and determined Jo, June Allyson gives one of the finest performances of her career, ably supported by the superb ensemble cast. The film is beautifully crafted and deservedly received an Academy Award nomination for its exceptional cinematography. Co-starring Rossano Brazzi as Professor Bhaer.

results.title: Rio Bravo(Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Armada Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Sheriff John T. Chance arrests a gunslinger for a brutal murder. However, the outlaw’s brother is the most powerful rancher on the border and his desperadoes surround Rio Bravo so that Chance can’t get his prisoner out and the U.S. Marshall can’t get in. Hired gunmen slip silently into the little town, waiting for a chance to strike. This classic western combines the talents of John Wayne and Dean Martin with the much acclaimed skill of Howard Hawks.

results.title: Flight of the innocent = La Corsa dell' innocente
results.creator_credit: Carlo Carlei, Domenico Procacci, Franco Castaldi, Fandango and Cristaldifilm
results.brief_description: This breathtakingly visual film, the first feature by Carlo Carei, captures the emotions and arouses the senses. Since 1966, due to the depressed economy in southern Italy, kidnapping has become almost an alternative industry. Men, women and children, from the wealthy north are kidnapped and used as bartering chips by their merciless captors. Feuds develop between rival gangs. Many survive…others are not so fortunate. The story centres upon Vito, a young Italian child whose family are in the kidnapping business and are brutally murdered by a rival gang. He escapes on a perilous journey with the murderers in hot pursuit. Although “Flight of the innocent” is fictional, similar events to those depicted continue to occur. Italian dialogue. English subtitles.

results.title: Carlito's way
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Michael S. Bregman, Willi Baer, Martin Bregman and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Carlito Brigante (Al Pacino) is a Puerto Rican drug-lord who has been released from prison and is convinced he will begin a new life and remove himself from the violence of his criminal past. Filmed by thriller-master, Brian De Palma, “Carlito’s Way” is both a fiery and fast-paced gangster film and a powerful study of an individual attempting to come to terms with the failures of his past. Pacino is outstanding as Carlito, and so is Sean Penn, as a coke-snorting lawyer who is enamoured by Carlito’s past but ignorant of the dangers involved. This film is a more baroque and expansive treatment of the themes De Palma explored in his earlier “Scarface”. This is an adult gangster movie. The disco-tinged score (the movie is set in the late-seventies), is by Jellybean Benitez and features some great Latin and salsa disco music.

results.title: Hammers over the anvil
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, Ben Gannon, South Australian Film Corporation and Harvest Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the stories of the same title by Alan Marshall, this is the story of a young boy who suffered many hardships in life, but none so savage as contracting polio and being unable to walk without crutches. Despite his affliction, he dreams of being a great horseman like the town’s hero, East Driscoll (Russell Crowe). Handsome and skilful, East is the most popular man in town, but as the boy discovers one summer, heroes can fall, and when East begins a passionate affair with an older woman, he comes face to face with a hard and cruel society with strict social taboos and even harsher penalties. It was a summer that would ultimately shape the rest of his life. NB: THIS PROGRAM IS RATED M. PARENTS SHOULD BE AWARE THAT IT IS SUITABLE FOR ADOLESCENTS ONLY.

results.title: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot
results.creator_credit: Michael Cimino, Robert Daley, Malpaso Company and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A golden field of wheat waves serenely under a blue Montana sky. A congregation of just-plain-folks in a quaint wooden church listens intently to the preacher. Then, just when you begin to wonder if you’ve somehow wandered into a Norman Rockwell painting, a man steps through the door and begins spraying the pulpit with automatic pistol fire. Clint Eastwood and Jeff Bridges star in this offbeat saga of a colourful group of bank robbers determined to “re-pull” a master heist of the fortress-like Montana Armoured Depository. In his directorial debut, Cimino injects the comedy-drama with an inventiveness and unpredictability rarely seen in the caper genre. Bridges received a Best Supporting Actor Academy Award nomination for his performance as Lightfoot.

results.title: Raiders of the lost ark
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Harrison Ford immortalised the character of thrillseeker archaeologist Indiana Jones in this first of the series. From the opening sequence filled with huge crawling tarantulas, golden idols and giant rolling stones, “Raiders of the lost ark” is a rollercoaster of thrills and action. Jones is on a mission to find the missing Lost Ark of the Covenant and encounters evil Nazi’s, slithering snakes, mummified bodies and red tape before he achieves his mission. Co-starring Karen Allen and Denholm Elliott. A great movie from master blockbuster filmmakers George Lucas and Steven Spielberg.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Paramount Pictures

results.title: Barefoot in the park
results.creator_credit: Gene Saks, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Jane Fonda and Robert Redford star in this Neil Simon comedy about a newly married couple. Corey and Paul Bratter begin their marriage in a tiny one-roomed apartment up six flight of stairs with the weirdest neighbours on Tenth Street. Corey is vivacious, fun-loving and impetuous, while Paul is a rising and very serious young Attorney. Joy turns to anguish, but they kiss and make up in the end. Fonda and Redford are delightful, while Charles Boyer as the aging Romeo who lives in the attic, and Mildred Natwick as Corey’s meek and mild mother are excellent. The script has the wit of Simon’s New York perspective.
